personal.name: Ashish Dubey
personal.title: Embedded Software Engineer
personal.description: 15+ years of expertise in safety-critical embedded systems for aerospace. From Boeing 787 to cutting-edge eVTOL programs, I architect software that powers the next generation of avionics and flight controls.

about.title: Crafting Mission-Critical Software
paragraphs: I'm a Senior Advanced Embedded Engineer at Honeywell Aerospace with over 15 years of experience developing safety-critical flight control systems. My work has directly contributed to large commercial and new-technology aircraft programs.

Currently pursuing my M.S. in Information Systems at the University of Washington's Michael G. Foster School of Business, I'm expanding my expertise into AI, ML, cybersecurity and cloud-enabled engineering workflows.
From Bengaluru to Phoenix to Seattle, I've delivered $3M+ in cost savings through intelligent automation and led teams building the software that keeps aircraft safe in the skies.

experience.title: Senior Advanced Embedded Engineer
experience.description: Leading safety-critical software integration for next-generation eVTOL programs. Architected ARINC 429 drivers and RS422 systems while improving test automation with Python and modern tooling.

experience.title: Advanced Embedded Engineer
experience.description: Designed flight control systems for Boeing 787 and Comac 919 using Embedded C on GHS & DEOS RTOS. Created critical airborne applications including FADEC and Landing Gear Control systems.

experience.title: Senior Software Engineer
experience.description: Developed flight control software for Embraer ERJ170, Gulfstream G650, and Comac ARJ21. Fixed flight test defects with high accuracy and created automation tools that saved thousands of hours.

experience.title: Software Engineer
experience.description: Designed software modules for Boeing 787 Wing Ice Protection Systems with very low defect density. Architected flash memory drivers and developed boot-up code for mission-critical systems.
